<DOMAIN>CHEF</DOMAIN>
<RESUME_START>
LEAD CHEF & FOOD TRUCK MANAGER

SUMMARY

At the Culinary Institute of America, I was taught and mentored by an expert team of world renowned chefs and professors
with outstanding industry and education credentials. I gained extensive exposure and experience through the advanced culinary
curriculum that is only offered at CIA. My education went beyond memorizing and executing foods, cooking techniques and
recipes - I learned how to analyze foods, how to adapt them, and most important ... how to get creative with them.
I am well
trained in both classic and contemporary culinary methods and techniques and developed a strong understanding of how to
prepare a wide variety of global cuisines, as well as, wine & beer pairing.
I have had the opportunity to work with famed Chef
Larry Forgione "The Godfather of American Cuisine" (father of Iron Chef Marc Forgione) Learning the true practice of
sourcing local ingredients into the restaurant known as farm-to-table cooking.
I gained extensive hands-on experience in CIA professional kitchens and bakeshops, and in their award-winning student-staffed
restaurants (including the American Bounty Restaurant, and Ristorante Caterina de' Medici, St.
Andrews Restaurant).
I gained
both back-of-the-house and front-of-the-house experience under the guidance of the expert faculty and through a 5 month
externship at Walt Disney World's 3rd signature premier restaurant "Artist Point" in Orlando, Florida at the Wilderness Lodge in
Magic Kingdom. Additionally, I gained solid professional experience at Cattail Creek Country club in Maryland, running the private
catering businesses.
Highlights
Focused and disciplined High volume production capability Contemporary sauce work Well-tuned palette
Sense of urgency ​Problem Solver
ServSafe certified

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Recipient of 2011 Glenelg High School Principal's Award for Exemplary Achievements (Only 13 graduates out of a class of 300 received this distinction).
Lead member of Glenelg High School's Culinary Team (ProStart Curriculum).
Achieved 3rd Place, 3rd Place, then 1st Place finish in the annual ProStart Competition.
Successfully managed the culinary kitchens at the Culinary Institute Of America Successfully worked my way up quickly through all stations at the Artist Point Resort in Walt Disney World, serving 300-700 covers each night with a cohesive team.
Successfully branched out on my own, traveling to Napa CA to continue pursuing my Personal Chef goals.

40+ hours/wk)

<JD_START>
Job Title: Executive Chef - 1927639

Location: Kansas City, MO

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Description

Looking for an Executive Chef to support major professional sports events! This role involves overseeing chef managers and hourly culinary staff, developing and implementing culinary solutions to meet customer needs, and managing stadium culinary operations. The Executive Chef will apply culinary techniques to food preparation and ensure high standards of production, presentation, and service.

Salary: $75-90K DOE

CANDIDATE MUST HAVE VERIFICATION

 Multi unit culinary management experience  Large catering event experience  S+E or Large venue experience 


Responsibilities:

 Ensure culinary production aligns with the Executional Framework. Establish and maintain culinary standards and techniques for food preparation. Manage a team of culinary staff to ensure quality food presentation. Train and supervise culinary and kitchen employees in best practice techniques. Provide coaching and create a shared understanding of goals and methods. Recognize and reward employees. Organize team meetings and daily huddles. Maintain staff records, including training and performance data. Develop client and guest relationships. Interact directly with guests. Stay informed about regional culinary trends. Meet food and labor targets. Focus on margin improvement and understand performance metrics. Ensure efficient execution and delivery of culinary products. Maintain food quality and safety standards. Comply with operational and safety standards. Understand and manage supply chain and procurement processes. Implement the Food Framework. Estimate food consumption and manage requisitions. Maintain equipment and ensure proper operation. Comply with food safety and quality assurance standards. Follow all applicable policies, rules, and regulations.


Qualifications

Requires at least 4 years of culinary experience

At least 2 years in a management role preferred

Requires a culinary degree or equivalent experience

Ability to multi-task

Ability to simplify the agenda for the team

Requires advanced knowledge of the principles and practices within the food profession.

This includes experiential knowledge required for management of people and/or problems.

Requires oral, reading, and written communication skills

CANDIDATE MUST HAVE VERIFICATION

 Multi unit culinary management experienceLarge catering event experienceS+E or Large venue experience


#onsite

Experience Level (if available): Associate
<JD_END>
